feed.title: William Shakespeare
feed.content: Good name in man and woman, dear my lord, is the immediate jewel of their souls: Who steals my purse steals trash; ’tis something, nothing. (Othello 3.3)

feed.title: William Shakespeare
feed.content: To be, or not to be —that is the question, Whether'tis nobler in the mind to suffer. The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune Or to take arms against a sea of troubles, And by opposing end them. To die —to sleep
